abstract: Nanosolar, a heavily financed Silicon Valley start-up whose backers include Google’s co-founders, plans to announce Tuesday that it has begun selling its innovative solar panels.
snippet: Nanosolar, a heavily financed Silicon Valley start-up whose backers include Google’s co-founders, plans to announce Tuesday that it has begun selling its innovative solar panels.
lead_paragraph: SAN JOSE, Calif.  Nanosolar, a heavily financed Silicon Valley start-up whose backers include Google’s co-founders, plans to announce Tuesday that it has begun selling its innovative solar panels, which are made using a technique that is being held out as the future of solar power manufacturing.

headline.main: Start-Up Sells Solar Panels at Lower-Than-Usual Cost
headline.print_headline: Start-Up Sells Solar Panels At Lower-Than-Usual Cost

abstract: European lawmakers say they will press the bloc’s fiercely independent antitrust regulators next month to look at data privacy issues surrounding Google‘s proposed takeover of the online ad tracker DoubleClick.
lead_paragraph: European lawmakers say they will press the bloc’s fiercely independent antitrust regulators next month to look at data privacy issues surrounding Google‘s proposed takeover of the online ad tracker DoubleClick.

headline.main: E.U. Lawmakers Urge Greater Scrutiny of Google Deal

abstract: A top Google scientist confirms what has been rumored for years: the company improves its search engine by asking thousands of part-time workers to rate Web sites.
snippet: A top Google scientist confirms what has been rumored for years: the company improves its search engine by asking thousands of part-time workers to rate Web sites.
lead_paragraph: UPDATE: Google called to clarify this post. Google uses this network of people to test proposed search formulas. But it largely doesn’t use humans to evaluate specific sites or results. See this post for details.

headline.main: The People Inside Google’s Black Box
